I wrote this in 2016, about Syrian kids attempting suicide due to their living conditions. One 12-year-old girl ate rat poison and survived, but when I asked if she would try again, she said ‚Äúif our situation doesn‚Äôt change, we should all kill ourselves‚Äùhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2016/06/29/syrias-refugee-children-have-lost-all-hope/¬†‚Ä¶

The situation of Syrian refugees hasn‚Äôt changed, it‚Äôs only become more horrific and desperate, so I guess I‚Äôm just tired of telling their stories when people are too exhausted and overwhelmed by the news to care. I won‚Äôt stop, but like most journalists who cover this, I‚Äôm tired.
